content.question: The graph represents a monopsonistic labor market and shows the marginal factor cost <math alttext="open parenthesis, M F C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><mtext>MFC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the marginal revenue product <math alttext="open parenthesis, M R P sub L, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>MRP</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the supply of labor <math alttext="open parenthesis, S sub L, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
